Module contents¶

class jaxparrow.grid.CGrid(ssh_lat: ndarray, ssh_lon: ndarray, u_lat: ndarray, u_lon: ndarray, v_lat: ndarray, v_lon: ndarray, ssh_value: ndarray, u_value: ndarray | None = None, v_value: ndarray | None = None, ssh_mask: ndarray | None = None, u_mask: ndarray | None = None, v_mask: ndarray | None = None, u_geos_value: ndarray | None = None, v_geos_value: ndarray | None = None)¶

Bases: object

Class representing the C-grid over which flows will be computed

compute_cyclogeostrophy(variational: bool = True, n_it: int | None = None, lr: float = 0.005, eps: float = 0.0001) → Tuple[ndarray | MaskedArray, ndarray | MaskedArray]¶

Computes the cyclogeostrophic velocities using either the variational or the iterative approach

Parameters:

  • variational (bool, optional) – flag indicating which approach to use, defaults to True

  • n_it (int, optional) – maximum number of iterations, defaults to None

  • lr (float, optional) – learning rate for the variational method, defaults to cyclo.LR_VAR

  • eps (float, optional) – residual tolerance for the iterative method, defaults to cyclo.EPSILON_IT

Returns:

U and V cyclogeostrophic velocity fields

Return type:

Tuple[Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray], Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]]

compute_geostrophy() → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]¶

Computes the geostrophic velocities from SSH values and derivatives, and U and V coriolis factor

Returns:

U and V geostrophic velocity fields

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]
